choices.label:

All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right:

The five dashed vertical lines parallel to the y axis are drawn at x equals negative 2 pi, negative pi, 0, pi, and 2 pi.

The first curve begins near y equals 8 to the right of the first dashed vertical line at x equals negative 2 pi, decreases as the curve trends down steeply then gradually to the right, passes through the point (negative 3 pi over 2 comma 0), then gradually then steeply continue down and right, ending near y equals negative 8 to the left of the second dashed vertical line at x equals negative pi.

The second, third, and fourth curves are congruent to the first curve but occur between consecutive pairs of dashed vertical lines.

The second curve begins to the right of (negative pi comma 8), decreases through (negative pi over 2 comma 0), and ends to the left of (0 comma negative 8).

The third curve begins to the right of (0 comma 8), decreases through (pi over 2 comma 0), and ends to the left of (pi comma negative 8).

The fourth curve begins to the right of (pi comma 8), decreases through (3 pi over 2 comma 0), and ends to the left of (2 pi comma negative 8).
